title: SKCanvas.Clear handles alpha incorrectly
body: I just updated from version 1.59.2 to 1.60.0 and noticed a strange behavior with my OpenGL-accelerated surface. I want to clear the surface to 0, 0, 0, 0 (fully transparent), but it seems like the Clear operation now multiplies the color with the existing values rather than setting them, which effectively makes Clear() a no-op with my settings. It worked fine in 1.59.2, and still works fine with my CPU backend.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: I know this has been a long time, but I still have not been able to repro this. What platform was this on? Are you using Xamarin.Forms?

comments.author: Ollhax
comments.body:
That's odd. I'll test some more on my end, and see if I can get a clean repro.

I'm on Win 10, working on my own engine (i.e. drawing to texture with OpenGL).

comments.author: Ollhax
comments.body: I found the problem. Skia seems to be changing more OpenGL settings since the last version, in particular the glFrontFace setting. I added code to swap it back after drawing the canvas, and now things work as expected. Sorry for wasting your time on this one - closing the task now.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: No problem. The issues that you notice will help everyone else.
